Sentencas: The effect of Sm doping on CeO2 for its use as a solid electrolyte material for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells (IT-SOFCs) has been explored here.
Titulo: Preparation and characterization of Ce1-xSmxO2-δ (x=0.1-0.3) as electrolyte material for intermediate temperature SOFC

Sentencas: Ce1-xSmxO2-delta (x = 0.1-0.3) samples are successfully synthesized by carbonate co-precipitation method.
Titulo: Preparation and characterization of Ce1-xSmxO2-δ (x=0.1-0.3) as electrolyte material for intermediate temperature SOFC

Sentencas: TG-DTA, XRD, Raman, UV Vis, FT-IR, SEM and ac-impedance are used for structural and electrical characterization.
Titulo: Preparation and characterization of Ce1-xSmxO2-δ (x=0.1-0.3) as electrolyte material for intermediate temperature SOFC

Sentencas: From the XRD patterns, wellcrystalline cubic fluorite structured solid solution is confirmed.
Titulo: Preparation and characterization of Ce1-xSmxO2-δ (x=0.1-0.3) as electrolyte material for intermediate temperature SOFC

Sentencas: Lattice parameters increased with increase in Sm3+ while the crystallite size decreased.
Titulo: Preparation and characterization of Ce1-xSmxO2-δ (x=0.1-0.3) as electrolyte material for intermediate temperature SOFC

Sentencas: The optical absorption spectra exhibits a red shift for Sm3+ doped CeO2.
Titulo: Preparation and characterization of Ce1-xSmxO2-δ (x=0.1-0.3) as electrolyte material for intermediate temperature SOFC

Sentencas: Raman spectra show an intense peak at 463 cm(-1), a characteristic peak for doped ceria.
Titulo: Preparation and characterization of Ce1-xSmxO2-δ (x=0.1-0.3) as electrolyte material for intermediate temperature SOFC
Preparation and characterization of Ce1-xSmxO2-δ (x=0.1-0.3) as electrolyte material for intermediate temperature SOFC

Sentencas: Based on ac-impedance data, the total oxygen ionic conductivity is highest for Ce0.8Sm0.2O2-delta in the temperature range of 473-623 K. (C) 2013 Elsevier Masson SAS.
Titulo: Preparation and characterization of Ce1-xSmxO2-δ (x=0.1-0.3) as electrolyte material for intermediate temperature SOFC
